SENT.plain: We report 4 patients with hemiplegia due to a posterior cerebral artery occlusion
Associated clinical signs were aphasia, alexia or a neglect syndrome, hemianopia, and hemisensory loss
Hemiplegia was due to infarction in the lateral midbrain
The level of the occlusion in the posterior cerebral artery may be located distal to the junction with the posterior communicating artery
